metadata.name: Home to the Ghosts #30
metadata.description: The ghosts of the trees and animals that once lived here still linger, their presence felt but not seen.

metadata.name: CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE #887
metadata.description:
1 of 5 in CENTURY-XXX, Series 2
Edition of 1000

Tribute to Herbert W. Franke
“In Honor of the Dinosaur of Computer Art” 

Herbert W. Franke, a pioneer of computer art, passed away on July 16, 2022 at the age of 95. CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE is an homage to Franke’s MONDRIAN software developed for the Texas Instruments TI 99/4 home computer in 1979, and it’s a fundraiser to digitize his archive:

“Our goal is to raise 20,000 Euro so that ZKM Karlsruhe can digitize Herbert W. Franke’s 1,800 manuscripts and make them publicly available. If we raise more money, it will be donated to the Rütgers Foundation which supports children and young adults in Africa so that they can get access to and work with technology.” 

Each frame, a single “pixel” is added to the CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE image. When the software first loads, 100,000 frames are run in the background to start things off. Keep it running for hours or days to see it transform entirely — it’s an “infinite animation.”

metadata.name: 8 Minutes Early #80
metadata.description:
Generative artwork - www.petitsapin.com
Press "s" in live view to download high-res version

metadata.name: Take Wing #173
metadata.description:
“Take Wing” is a generative art collection depicting the hope, optimism, and thrilling excitement of a person taking off, gaining traction, and soaring to new heights and off into the great unknown.  

The algorithm behind the piece stems from an attempt to go back to art fundamentals and codify composition rules and painterly techniques into a generative form - taking into account focal points, contrast, eye movement, and color theory while still giving the algorithm freedom to explore random color palettes, random flow field movement, random brush strokes, and many other degrees of freedom.

The collection is made in pure code with p5.js and a few GLSL fragment shaders.

The piece has been created to be exhibited at "In Touch" with VerticalCryptoArt in Berlin in September 2022, curated by Anika Meier.

------------------------------------------------

To get a (somewhat) high-resolution output, open the live view of your token, and then edit the URL adding &h=5400 at the end of it.  5400 is the tallest you can go, but you can also put a smaller number if you desire.  Be aware that this will only work on a machine with a very beefy GPU, and even then may take a bit, so please be patient!

metadata.name: Cosmic Signs #101
metadata.description:
Cosmic Signs is part of a series of generative works that explore the algorithmic space of typographic signs, symbols and glyphs. This latest work builds on my first piece, Cosmic Type, released in July 2022. The series is informed by my interest in language, signs, meaning at large and more specifically inspired by the early pioneering work of the concrete poets such as Dom Sylvester Houédard, Ian Hamilton Finley, Steve McCaffe and Bob Cobbing.

Thank you for collecting.

Key Interactions

‘a’ activates motion on/off
‘+’ rotates symmetry
‘Arrow right/left’ change grid margin
'r' reset to initial starting image
‘q’ reset all
’s’ save png file
‘e’ save svg file



Program written by Mark Webster
Font is copyright ©simonrenaud

https://mwebster.online/pages/cosmicsigns
areafour.xyz
@motiondesign_01

metadata.name: Organic Diffusion #123
metadata.description:
Organic diffusion, a silent guide,
Through the veils of chaos, we abide.
In the microscopic realm, secrets unfold,
A journey of mystery, yet untold...

Display : Organic diffusion adapts by default to any screen, with an artwork changing depending on width and height (while maintaining the same parameters). In Vertical mode, the artwork displayed will be the captured (preview) one. Meant to be displayed on walls for an extended period, allowing enjoyment of the ever-changing artwork...

First minter gets 25% of royalties.

Options :
p to pause/unpause
s to save
1, 2, ... to increase the resolution (3 to get 3000pixels in height, etc...)
c to capture the same preview
d to toggle display between fullscreen and vertical (4:3)
+/- to increase/decrease details
z to zoom-in
f to increase some speed
v to start/stop the webm video capture
a in live view will allow to capture the 1000 seeds in low res images to help you choose your favorites

metadata.name: Vertex Butterfly #30
metadata.description: Researching within the realms of randomness, learning more and more each day to yield increasingly original outcomes

metadata.name: Vertex Butterfly #36

metadata.name: Birthday in my way #30
metadata.description:
I was born on this earth
We were born on this earth

I have a name
I have a voice
I have a body
I have a language
I have emotions
By chance

I can get angry
I can speak
I can imagine
By chance

Gradually, I am being killed
If everything stops living
How would words live?

I was born by chance
By chance, I have "thinking"
And probably have the eyes able to see one person one by one

metadata.name: Observance #174
metadata.description:
Happy birthday fxhash!

Observance is a collection of 365 pieces, one to mark each day of fxhash's first year.

4 seasons
7 days
12 months
365 dates

Each piece has an alternate birthday palette & all pieces can be saved as an SVG for plotting

Hit 'p' in live mode to save a 3720 × 5262px PNG
Hit 's' in live mode to save a plottable SVG

This is a generative NFT work by aotearoan, 2022

50% of proceeds go to support Processing.org

License: CC BY-NC-SA-4.0

metadata.name: Mind scribbles #92
(kinder)Garden, Monuments #294
metadata.description:
When Yazid and Zancan started their fxcollab journey, they knew very little about each other. They learnt about their rich cultural differences, their complementary graphic styles, and a 7-hour timezone difference. What they did have in common was each had two kids about the same age (one a pair of girls, the other boys).

Every kid was born a builder; every kid likes to sit in nature. It’s their way of discovering the world and dreaming of their future accomplishments. While they marvel at the heights of the cities and monuments they construct out of stacks of cubes, parents marvel at their ability to elaborate an unlimited range of worlds out of a limited range of materials. 

This project celebrates the humble and versatile cube. A deceptively simple yet powerful object of play and learning, regardless of age, whether you’re stacking them up in a sandbox, or learning 3D graphics for the first time. 

This project is dedicated to kids, those who were once children, to the dreamers and builders who still enjoy playing with cubes.

Coded in Vanilla JS, the project combines Yazid's iconic “Hashed/Hatched” aesthetic incorporated into childhood wooden toy block structures, and Zancan's signature lush foliage and framework, which enables all iterations to be plottable.
 
Controls (in live view):
- Press [s] to get a SVG file suited for plotters
- Click on the image to download a 4K resolution PNG

metadata.name: immiscible #18
metadata.description:
"immiscible" : not capable of combining to form a homogeneous mixture

- a multiphasic flow simulation, like a lava-lamp
     or with people in today's world, where the result is beauty and chaos

---------
Made with a wave-bent fluid simulation in javascript
Some images are monochrome and some have the colours quantized to a 5-colour palette
Press "s" to save image (2200x1200px)
Press "p" to continue and toggle animation of (attempted) mixing

metadata.name: Minimal perturbation #194
metadata.description:
Repeating a small, subtle change until it becomes the only thing to be seen.
Even imperceptible changes can bring a (completely different) perspective.

Open live mode and press 'S' to download SVG.
Press 'P' to add frame and landmarks for plotting.

metadata.name: Constellation Of Happiness #318
metadata.description:
Constellation Of Happiness is a collaborative art project between NFT artists Kato Trofimova and Andrew Erickson.

Feeling happy is tough this year but it'll be much easier when you get your own constellation of happiness! Using expressionistic code art, Constellation Of Happiness channels the purest festive emotions a person can experience, for example, when tasting champagne bubbles or seeing and touching confetti. All these are turned into beautiful constellations of happiness using the aesthetics of star maps and carefully brought to your NFT collection.

2022

Kato Trofimova (Latvia) is an illustrator, visual artist, and creative director known for her love of minimalistic shapes and bright palettes. In her art, Kato questions boundaries between styles and stays optimistic no matter what.

Andrew Erickson (Switzerland) is a generative artist experimenting with various abstract styles. Be it delicate monochromatic line art or colorful gradient minimalism, Andrew is very good at coding any kind of digital beauty.

Hit 'p' in live mode to save a 9922 × 14032px PNG (for printing up to A0)
Hit 's' in live mode to save a plottable SVG

10% of proceeds go to support Processing.org

License: CC BY-NC-SA-4.0

metadata.name: Collider series - Primitive Expansion #115
metadata.description:
f(hash) = singularity
A glimpse on the primitive expansion of time and space.

500000 particles, pure JS/WebGL/ThreeJS code

Press 'B' to see the primitive expansion animation
Press 'S' to save a 4K PNG of current view (4096x2304)

metadata.name: Clerestory #56
metadata.description:
Windows welcome daylight, admit fresh air, and offer a view into the outside world. They rarely shatter, always confess the passage of time, and sometimes allow others a chance to look in.

What would the space you're in feel like if it had no windows?

'Clerestory' is an abstract exploration of stained glass windows, drafting shattered sketches for ten potential locations from various perspectives and moments in time. 

Made with WebGL, p5.js, and <3 | CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
